intro: Triuris lutea, commonly known as the yellow triuris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and may have a hairy texture, while its stems are often woody and branching. Triuris lutea is noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
